title: R&B Hall of Fame announces latest inductees
text:
R&B Hall of Fame announces latest inductees James Brown, Gladys Knight, Isaac Hayes, Patti LaBelle, Mary Wells, Mitch Ryder among those to be honored June 11 Post to Facebook R&B Hall of Fame announces latest inductees James Brown, Gladys Knight, Isaac Hayes, Patti LaBelle, Mary Wells, Mitch Ryder among those to be honored June 11   Freep.com: http://on.freep.com/2mcoz03   Join the Conversation   R&B Hall of Fame announces latest inductees Brian McCollum , Detroit Free Press Pop Music Critic 3:09 p.m. ET Feb. 23, 2017 Gladys Knight is among the national performers booked for this year’s River Days fest. (Photo: Carlos Osorio, Associated Press) 1 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
James Brown, Gladys Knight & the Pips, Isaac Hayes and Patti LaBelle are among the figures tapped as 2017 inductees into the Rhythm & Blues Hall of Fame. 
They're among 13 names announced this week — including Detroit-related figures such as Mary Wells, the Marvelettes, Mitch Ryder and Carl Carlton — as the organization prepares for its June 11 ceremony at Music Hall. 
Also on the 2017 list are Motown guitarist Dennis Coffey, early Motown group the Valadiers and longtime Detroit radio jock Clarence (Foody) Rome, along with the Impressions and Lenny Williams. 
Special honorees at the June induction ceremony will include the Temptations (R&B Group of the 20th Century), the Rev. Al Sharpton (Living Legend Award), Martha Reeves (R&B Music Icon Award) and U.S. Rep. Brenda Lawrence (LaMont D. Robinson Visionary Award). 
Lawrence, U.S. Rep. John Conyers and Detroit City Councilwoman Mary Sheffield were among those on hand for Tuesday's announcement event at Bert's Entertainment Complex in Eastern Market. Also in attendance were Motown mainstays Reeves, Coffey, Kim Weston and members of the Contours. 
The R&B Hall of Fame, spearheaded by LaMont Robinson, has been in the hunt for a permanent home, with cities including Detroit, Philadelphia, Cleveland and Clarksdale, Miss., among those in the mix at various points. This year's induction ceremony follows the 2016 event at Dearborn's Ford Community & Performing Arts Center. 
Tickets for the June 11 Music Hall show are $45-$95 and can be purchased at the venue box office or via Ticketmaster . Read or Share this story: http://on.freep.com/2mcoz03
